job_title: Director of Oncology in Port Clinton, OH
pros:
Everyone who works here has a friendly smile and knows each other by name
The senior leadership team works with each and every person in management to help build strengths by providing continuous education
Education reimbursement is offered to employees
Benefits are great, illness can be used for doctor appointments
cons: Wages for staff that have been here longer are not comparable to other facilities, but competitive for new employees

job_title: Registered Nurse in Port Clinton, OH
pros: Good place to work. Small town feel. Everyone knows everyone. People very friendly

job_title: Network Systems Analyst in Port Clinton, OH
pros: Small, tight-knit community.  Easy to know everyone who works there and has a small-town feel.
cons: Culture has allowed to become toxic in many departments.  Employees are fearful of retaliation for reporting issues.  Reports of Safety and other issues get pushed aside or bandaged instead of fixed due to financial concerns.  Instead of leading the hospital by example, favoritism plays a large part in hospital politics.  Some physicians have been given what amounts to carte blanche with their demands.  Project Management is non-existent and projects routinely get eviscerated for funds / resources instead of allowing them to complete.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Port Clinton, OH
pros: I love this hospital.  This is a small community hospital and the employees here work very diligently to make sure that the patient's expectations are met.  Because we are a Critical Access hospital we have the ability to offer our patients Skilled Nursing care for those circumstances where the patient does not meet the inpatient requirements, but is also not ready to be home yet.   For employees, this is the place to come if you want to have work life balance and to feel like you have done something to directly impact the health and wellness of your patients. The benefits are great, and the staff are encouraged to give feedback about things they believe can be improved.
cons: Because it is a Critical Access hospital, if you are looking for tertiary care, you won't find it here.

review_title: This place is nightmare. Avoid at all costs if you are a Nurse Practitioner expecting to be treated like a professional.
job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Port Clinton, OH
pros: I found the schedule to be beneficial to my situation, working three, 12 hour shift per week.  The pay was decent.
cons: Very difficult to know where to start. I turned out that I was the first NP to come to this place and work full-time in my position and the management appeared to have no idea on how to create this new position; what support my position might require or even how to treat a professional. I had little to no support. I had no office, I had no phone, no mailbox, no PC. I had no place to dictate my encounters. I had no support staff or case managers to run the day-to-day business.  It turned out that it was a very bad idea accepting a job with this employer in the Urgent Care / Occupational Health clinic. I was treated very unprofessionally by my manager, like a factory worker.  I was hired and told that they needed my consultation and experience as I had opened these new clinic successfully in the past. It turned out they just wanted a worker bee. The staff and leadership are mostly small town rural folk, have been there for many years, doing things their own way, they don't want to hear how anyone else does anything and are rudely resistant to change and outsiders. The constant gossip in this place was mind-numbing. There is very arbitrary and selective policy enforcement which management uses to meet their ever-changing personal objectives and to manipulate the staff to those ends. They have very regular internal announcements about their "top ratings" which appear to be clearly manufactured. Final word, if you do accept a position with this employer - insist on a contract drawn up by an attorney with contract experience. If they refuse, that tells you all you need to know. A good employer has no fear of a contract. They know how to treat their employees and how to keep their word. The physical plant is outdated and in bad need of repair. Our toilets were constantly backing up and overflowing in a brand new clinic. The emergency department is badly in need of a complete rebuild. There are people in management positions which are completely unqualified in terms of their education and experience but have been there so long that the management does not know how to get rid of them. There is then the second dilemma that management has allowed their employment to continue for so many years in the first place with full knowledge that the employee is obviously unqualified for the job which reflects poorly on senior management. There are people who have only worked in this place their whole careers and nowhere else and this contributes to the problem of change resistance and lack of a view of how the real world works in healthcare.

pros: Some of the best reasons to work at Magruder Hospital is the exceptional patient care, Safety compliance, and the kind hearted staff that truly care.
cons: Pay grades could be better. But not bad.

pros: Great Benefits, wonderful community, we are like a family here.  The CEO knows us by first name.  The people of our community really appreciate the work we do here
cons: I cannot think of a single one
